Train an IUCNN Model

Source: R/train_iucnn.R
train_iucnn.Rd

Trains an IUCNN model based on a data,frame of features, for instance generated by geo_features, |linkclim_features, and biome_features, and a dataset of labels, (i.e. IUCNN classes) for each species.

train_iucnn(
  x,
  labels,
  path_to_output = "",
  model_name = "iuc_nn_model",
  validation_split = 0.1,
  test_fraction = 0.1,
  seed = 1234,
  max_epochs = 1000,
  n_layers = c(60, 60, 20),
  use_bias = 1,
  act_f = "relu",
  patience = 500
)

Arguments

x

a data.set, containing a column "species" with the species names, and subsequent columns with different features, in the same order as used for predict_iucnn.
labels

a data.frame with two columns, first "species" with the species name, second "labels with the labels (i.e. IUCN categories).
path_to_output

character string. The path to the location where the IUCNN model shall be saved
model_name

character string. The name of the model.
validation_split

numeric. The fraction of the input data used for validation.
test_fraction

numeric. The fraction of the input data used as test data.
seed

specify the python seed.
max_epochs

integer. The maximum number of epochs.
n_layers

numeric vector with length three. The number of layers of the neural network.
use_bias

integer (1/0). Should bias be used
act_f

character string. The act-f value
patience

integer. The patience value.

Value

a folder in the working directory (or as specified with path_to_output) with the trained model, for use by predict_iucnn.

Note

See vignette("Approximate_IUCN_Red_List_assessments_with_IUCNN") for a tutorial on how to run IUCNN.
